abstract: Union leaders express concern about candidacy of Donald Trump, whose unapologetic views on certain economic issues and unconventional politics resonate with some members; fear that Trump may draw large numbers of union voters, and could bolster Republicans in swing states like Ohio and Michigan.
lead_paragraph: Labor leaders fear that Mr. Trump may draw an unusually large number of union voters, possibly improving Republican chances in a November general election.

headline.main: Unions Lean Democratic, but Donald Trump Gets Members’ Attention

snippet: Labor leaders fear that Mr. Trump may draw an unusually large number of union voters, possibly improving Republican chances in a November general election.

keywords.value: American Federation of Labor-Congress of Industrial Organizations
keywords.name: organizations
